 (multipart/alternative)

This is a multi-part message in MIME format. 
 
MIME element (text/plain)
December 11, 2006 
 
  
 
VIA ELECTRONIC MAIL 
 
ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.  
 
1333 North Stemmons Freeway, Suite 110  
 
Dallas, TX 75207 
 
Email:  abuse@theplanet.com 
 
Fax: (214) 782-7801 
 
  
 
  
 
            RE:  Counterfeit Goods on 
http://www.getti.us/designerfabrics.html (the "Site")       
 
  
 
Dear Sir/Madam: 
 
  
 
I CERTIFY UNDER PENALTY OF PERJURY that I am an agent authorized to act
on behalf of Burberry Limited ("IP Owner"), the owner of certain
intellectual property rights, specifically federal trademark
registrations 2,022,789 and 1,133,122 for the BURBERRY CHECK trademark
and registrations 260,843; 510,077 and 1,133,122 and the BURBERRY word. 
 
 
  
 
Getti.us is offering for sale fabric that displays one or more of our
trademarks, but is NOT authentic Burberry fabric.  Because these
materials found through the links below are not authorized by the IP
Owner, its agent, or the law , they infringe the IP Owner's rights
according to state, federal, or United States law. 
 
  
 
The following are links to the infringing uses: 
 
  
 
http://www.getti.us/designerfabrics.html 
 
  
 
I am requesting that ThePlanet, pursuant to its Acceptable Use Policy
("AUP"), shut down the Site for offering for sale counterfeit goods.  In
particular, I refer to those parts of the AUP that read: 
 
"Intellectual Property Infringement Policy" 
 
"Customers may not transmit, distribute, download, copy, cache, host, or
otherwise store on a Server any information, data, material, or work
that infringes the intellectual property rights of others. The Planet
has the right to disable access to, or remove, infringing content to the
extent required under any law or regulation, including the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998." 
 
"The Planet reserves the right to suspend permanently or terminate the
Services of any Customer that repeatedly violates The Planet's
Intellectual Property Infringement Policy or any copyright law." 
 
Based on the flagrant violation of the AUP by
http://www.getti.us/designerfabrics.html, Burberry kindly requests that
ThePlanet provide the remedial action of terminating its contractual 
relationship with the Site or otherwise bring it into compliance.   
 
  
 
Sincerely, 
 
  
 
Fabio R. Silva 
 
Intellectual Property Counsel 
 
BURBERRY LIMITED, USA
1350 Ave of the Americas
New York, NY  10019
212-707-6500 main
212-707-6545 direct dial
212-246-2486 fax 
 
  
 
  
 
 
 
This  message, including any attachment(s) is confidential information
and  is  for  the  sole use of the intended recipient(s). Unauthorized

strictly  prohibited.  If  you  are not the intended recipient, please
notify  the  sender  by  replying  to this mail message and delete all
copies of the original message and any attachments.
